body_html:
Possibly some repackaging needs to be done because currently importing using namespaces returns ImportError:

>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.__version__
'0.9.0'
>>> from tensorflow.nn import rnn, rnn_cell
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: No module named 'tensorflow.nn'

>>> tf.nn.rnn
<function rnn at 0x7f79cf35ea60>
>>> tf.nn.rnn_cell
<module 'tensorflow.python.ops.rnn_cell' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/rnn_cell.py'>

Is there an existing issue to allow namespaces in tensorflow?

body:
Possibly some repackaging needs to be done because currently importing using namespaces returns `ImportError`:

``` python
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.__version__
'0.9.0'
>>> from tensorflow.nn import rnn, rnn_cell
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: No module named 'tensorflow.nn'

>>> tf.nn.rnn
<function rnn at 0x7f79cf35ea60>
>>> tf.nn.rnn_cell
<module 'tensorflow.python.ops.rnn_cell' from '/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/rnn_cell.py'>
```

Is there an existing issue to allow namespaces in tensorflow?
